editor.name: QuestEditor
editor.info: The QuestEditor is a task based quest editing tool for Star Wars Galaxies. A quest is made up of tasks. The tasks are data driven scripts that run on the player during the quest. Fields are defined by the script author and provide information used to execute the task. Tasks are represented hierarchically in the Task Tree View. When a task completes, child tasks are activated. The field taskOnFail indicates whether the task is activated on a failure condition or not.

defaultTask.info: Tasks are data driven scripts that execute during a quest. All tasks have a default set of fields. The default fields are detailed here.

data.name: questJournal
data.info: These fields provide text that is displayed in the quest journal.

data.name: journalEntryTitle
data.info: A short localized string that is the title of this task. It is displayed in the journal when the quest is openned and it is also optionally displayed as part of the system message recieved when the task completes.

data.name: journalEntryDescription
data.info: A localized string that provides addition detail for active selected tasks. In addition, the counter or timer displays are appended to the quest journal after this description ends.

data.name: isVisible
data.info: Indicates whether or not the journal entry is visible. Keep in mind that counter and timers are only displayed if the journal entry is visible.

data.name: questRules
data.info: These fields provide info on quest rules.

data.name: prerequisiteTasks
data.info: A list of comma delimited task ids that are prerequisites (i.e. required) for this task to be activated.

data.name: exclusionTasks
data.info: A list of comma delimited task ids that must no be completed for this task to be activated.

data.name: allowRepeats
data.info: Indicates whether or not the task is allowed to repeat while the quest is active.

data.name: taskName
data.info: The name of the task which is used to uniquely identify this task. Task may be identified in order to manually complete, activate, or query the its status.

data.name: showSystemMessages
data.info: Indicates whether or not to display a system message on task completion. The message is comprised of the quest list journalEntryTitle and task journalEntryTitle. and the pass or fail status.

data.name: questMusic
data.info: These fields provide info on quest music.

data.name: musicOnActivate
data.info: The music template file to play when a task activates.

data.name: musicOnComplete
data.info: The music template file to play when a task activates.

data.name: musicOnFail
data.info: The music template file to play when a task activates.

data.name: taskOnFail
data.displayName: Grant This Task On Parent Task Failure
data.info: Indicates the whether the task is activated when the parent task completes or fails. When set to true, the parent task's failure condition must be met for this task to activate. See the task specific information for failure conditions.

data.name: chanceToActivate
data.info: This value is the chance a task will activate. If the value is 0 then the task will always activate which is the default. If the value is greater than 0, then it is the chance this task will activate compared to other child tasks with chance settings. For example, if 3 sibling tasks have chance settings of 1, 1, and 1 then when the parent task completes, 1 out of the 3 will activate with a 33% chance per task, basically an even chance that any one of the 3 will activate. If 2 sibling tasks have chances of 4 and 1 and another has a chance of 0, then the first task has an 80% chance of activating and the second has a 20% channce and the third will always activate in addition to either the first or second. For sibling tasks with chance settings other than 0, only 1 of them will ever activate when the parent task completes. Currently, failure does not support the chance setting.

data.name: questControl
data.info: These fields provide allow the task to control clearing or completing the quest.

data.name: questControlOnTaskCompletion
data.info: Set this value to control what happens to the quest when the task completes. The values are none (nothing happens), complete (the quest is completed), and clear (the quest is cleared).

data.name: questControlOnTaskFailure
data.info: Set this value to control what happens to the quest when the task fails. The values are none (nothing happens), complete (the quest is completed), and clear (the quest is cleared).

data.name: grantQuests
data.info: These fields provide info on quests to grant automatically when this task completes or fails.

data.name: grantOnComplete
data.info: Grant this quest when the task completes.

data.name: grantQuestOnComplete
data.info: The name of the quest to grant when this task completes successfully.

data.name: grantQuestOnCompleteShowSystemMessage
data.info: If true, display the system message and play the grant quest music otherwise grant the quest silently.

data.name: grantOnFail
data.info: Grant this quest when the task fails.

data.name: grantQuestOnFail
data.info: The name of the quest to grant when this task fails.

data.name: grantQuestOnFailShowSystemMessage
data.info: If true, display the system message and play the grant quest music otherwise grant the quest silently.

data.name: taskSignals
data.info: These fields specify which quest signals to send when a task completes or fails.

data.name: signalsOnComplete
data.info: A comma delimited list of signal names to send on task completion.

data.name: signalsOnFail
data.info: A comma delimited list of signal names to send on task failure.

data.name: taskWaypoint
data.info: The following fields provide input for automatic waypoint creation and cleanup. The waypoint is created and activated while the task is active and is destroyed when the task completes.

data.name: createWaypoint
data.info: Setting this to true enables waypoint creation otherwise no waypoint is automatically created.

data.name: Planet
data.info: The planet string used in the location of the waypoint.

data.name: LocationX(m)
data.info: The WORLD X location of the waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building.

data.name: LocationY(m)
data.info: The WORLD Y location of the waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building. The value may safely be set to zero.

data.name: LocationZ(m)
data.info: The WORLD Z location of the waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building.

data.name: interiorWaypointAppearance
data.info: An optional field that is used as the waypoint appearance if this is an interior waypoint.

data.name: buildingCellName
data.info: An optional field giving the name of the cell, if a waypoint is inside a building.

data.name: waypointName
data.info: A short localized string that describes the waypoint.

data.name: entranceWaypoint
data.info: The following fields provide input for automatic entrance waypoint creation and cleanup. The waypoint is created and activated while the task is active and is destroyed when the task completes. This is a specific entrance waypoint to be used to aid the player in finding the door to the POB, it will be represented with a special door symbol in the radar as well. The interior waypoint will not display correctly when using this waypoint unless you make sure to identify the cell and appearance data in the internal waypoint.

data.name: createEntranceWaypoint
data.info: Setting this to true enables entrance waypoint creation otherwise no entrance waypoint is automatically created.

data.name: EntranceLocationX(m)
data.info: The WORLD X location of the entrance waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building.

data.name: EntranceLocationY(m)
data.info: The WORLD Y location of the entrance waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building. The value may safely be set to zero.

data.name: EntranceLocationZ(m)
data.info: The WORLD Z location of the entrance waypoint, even if the waypoint is in a building.

data.name: entranceWaypointName
data.info: A short localized string that describes the entrance waypoint.

tasks.info: Tasks are data driven scripts that run on the player during a quest. This section explains each currently available task, the specific information required, and the failure condition if any.

task.info: Opens the communication interface and displays a message to the player. There is has no failure condition.

data.name: Comm Message Text
data.info: A localized string displayed to the player in the communication interface.

data.name: NPC Appearance Server Template
data.info: The server template of the NPC appearance that is displayed in the communication interface.

task.info: Completes when the item is successfully crafted by the player. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Craft Item
data.info: Information regarding the item to craft.

data.name: Server Object Template
data.info: The server template of the draft schematic the player must successfully craft with.

data.name: Count
data.info: The number of items to craft.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: The player must kill a certain number of creatures. The task has a journal counter. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Target Server Template
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that must be kill by the player.

data.name: Social Group
data.info: An optional field that specifies a social group from the creatures data table. The player may kill any creature in this social group and it will count toward the total needed to complete this task. Setting this value will cause the Target Server Template field to be ignored.

data.name: requiredRegion
data.info: If specified, this field provides an additonal region restriction on the kills.

data.name: Count
data.info: The number of creatures to kill.

data.name: RewardCredits
data.info: The reward the player receives by completing the task. This must be a positive value otherwise it will be ignored.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: The player must kill and successfully loot a certain number of items. By looting it means a roll agains LootDropPercent and, if successfully, the count is increment. This task has a journal counter. There is no failure condition.

data.name: CreatureType
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that must be kill by the player.

data.name: Social Group
data.info: An optional field that specifies a social group from the creatures data table. The player may kill any creature in this social group and it will count toward the total needed to complete this task. Setting this value will cause the Target Server Template field to be ignored.

data.name: requiredRegion
data.info: If specified, this field provides an additonal region restriction on the kills.

data.name: LootItemName
data.info: The name of item displayed to the player when the loot roll succeeds.

data.name: NumberItemsRequired
data.info: The number of loot drop items that must be found (i.e. successful rolls against <b>LootDropPercent<).

data.name: LootDropPercent
data.info: The percentage chance a creature will drop loot when killed.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccess
data.info: Guaranteed Success means that the player will be guaranteed to successfully loot the target item on the specified attempt regardless of the Drop Rate percentage. The minimum and maximum range will be used to randowly choose the attempt at which this will occur (if the minimum and maximum are the same, then that value will always be used). So, for example, if the guaranteed attempt is set to 10, so after 9 attempts in a row without successfully looting the quest item (failing the percent roll), the 10th attempt will be guaranteed to succeed. After any successful attempt, the guaranteed success count resets and begins again. Guaranteed Success allows the quest to minimize a run of bad luck with the Drop Rate. It also allows a quest to have a limited number of quest targets by guaranteeing that the player will succeed on the last target if all of the others have failed. For example, if there are 4 guards and only 1 of them have the keycard that the player must find, a Guaranteed Success of 4 will mean that if the player fails to find the keycard in the first 3, they will be guaranteed to find it in the 4th one. If the minimum/maximum values are left at 0, then Guaranteed Success will not be used.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccessMinumumAttempts
data.info: The minimum number of attempts for a guaranteed success. If the minimum equals the maximum, then that value will be used, otherwise a random value will be chosen between the minimum and maximum (inclusive). If set to 0, guaranteed success will not be used at all.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccessMaximumAttempts
data.info: The maximum number of attempts for a guaranteed success. If the maximum equals the minimum, then that value will be used, otherwise a random value will be chosen between the minimum and maximum (inclusive). If set to 0, guaranteed success will not be used at all.

data.name: RewardCredits
data.info: The reward the player receives by completing the task. This must be a positive value otherwise it will be ignored.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Causes creatures to spawn and attach the player. An encounter fails if the player is killed.

data.name: Creature Type
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that is spawned during the encounter.

data.name: Count
data.info: The number of creatures to spawn.

data.name: Min Distance
data.info: The minimum distance around the player to spawn the creatures.

data.name: Max Distance
data.info: The maximum distance around the player to spawn the creatures.

data.name: Spawn Offset Location
data.info: A relative offset from the player's location to use when spawning the creatures.

data.name: Spawn Offset Location X(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Spawn Offset Location Z(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Spawn a creatures and have it follow the player. The failure condition is when the target creature dies. [there are currently issues with this task and static escort is recommended instead.]

data.name: Escort Creature Type
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that the player must escort.

task.info: Defend the quest giving object. The failure condition is when the object is destroyed or the player travels too far away.
Player gives x items to NPC. Items can be static or object templates. A single item may optionally be created and destroyed by the task. Failure conditions may be set to cause the tasks to fail.

data.name: itemToGive
data.info: The name of the item(s) to give the NPC. Items can be static or object templates. Multiple items divided by commas(,).

data.name: itemCount
data.info: The number of items to give to the NPC.

data.name: createItem
data.info: Indicates whether or not activating this task creates the specified item. Note - only the first item will be created if a list of items is specified.

data.name: destroyItem
data.info: Indicates whether or not clearing, completing, or failing this task destroys the item created by it. Only works for an item that is created by this task.

data.name: Time Settings
data.info: These fields are used to set time settings.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

data.name: remainingTime
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task has a max time, it is the number of remaining seconds before the timer ends when the task may be completed. For example, if max time is 120 seconds and remaining time is 20 seconds, then the task can only be completed after 100 seconds have passed.

data.name: failOnLogout
data.info: If true, this task will fail if the player logs out of the game while it is active.

data.name: Travel Control
data.info: These fields allow control to restrict travel options available to the player while the task is active. Travel control only applies to tasks that are set to fail on logout.

data.name: travelBlock
data.info: If true, the player is blocked from using any form of travel. These include shuttle, starport, instant, personal ship, and launching into space.

data.name: travelBlockAllowLaunch
data.info: If blocking travel, setting this to true will allow the player to launch into space.

data.name: textType
data.info: This field is used to select the text used in the journal counter and in the progress system message. Currently 'give' indicates text that refers to items given and 'deliver' indicates text about delivery.

task.info: The player must go to within radius distance of the set location. The location is determined by the fields in taskWaypoint. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Radius(m)
data.info: The radius around the point the player must be within for the task to complete.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Grants a player a space quest and then waits for the outcome.

data.name: questToGrant
data.info: The name of the quest to give the Player

data.name: questType
data.info: The type of space quest being granted (assassination, escort, patrol, etc.)

data.name: ignoreSplit
data.info: Determines whether or not the quest task should ignore the space quest if it splits.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: End the quest and leave its state as completed. All active tasks will be cleaned up. No further tasks are activated. There is no failure condition.
Cause all active tasks to clean up and removes the quest from the player. There is no failure condition.
Do nothing. This task can be uses initially in a quest to cause multiple child task to automatically activate at quest start. There is no failure condition.
The player must peform for a specified duration. There is no failure condition.

data.name: performDuration
data.info: The time in seconds the performance must last.

data.name: performCellname
data.info: The name of the cell in which to perform. If empty then the use the building obj id field below.

data.name: performBuilding
data.info: The object id of the building in which to perform. If 0 then the player may perform anywhere. If the cellname is set then that value overrides this setting.

data.name: performType
data.info: Indicates what must be performed where the choices are anything (0), dance (1), music (2), or juggling (3).

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: The player must peform an action on a specific NPC. There is no failure condition.

data.name: actionName
data.info: The action to perform on the NPC.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: An object is spawned in a remote scene and the player and/or group must destory it within a time limit.

data.name: creatureName
data.info: The name of the creature to spawn.

data.name: encounterSceneName
data.info: The name of the scene to spawn the encounter. Leave this blank to choose a scene based on difficulty.

data.name: minDifficulty
data.info: The minumim difficulty of the scene picked for the encounter.

data.name: maxDifficulty
data.info: The maximum difficulty of the scene picked for the encounter.

data.name: inSpace
data.info: Indicates whether the chosen scene is in space or not.

data.name: encounterDuration
data.info: The time in seconds of the player has to kill the creature before the encounter fails.

data.name: encounterWhereMessage
data.info: A localized string that displays the scene name where the encounter was spawned. This string must have a %TO which will be replaced with the localized scene name.

data.name: useItemMenuString
data.info: Localized string that appears as the use option on the item the player must use during the quest.

data.name: itemUsedSystemMessage
data.info: Localized system message string that appears if this task is visible and the player uses the quest item.

task.info: The player must retrieve a certain number of items. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Server Object Template
data.info: The server object template file name of the item to retrieve.

data.name: Count
data.info: The number of items to retrieve.

data.name: ItemName
data.info: The name of the item to retrieve.

data.name: LootDropPercent
data.info: The chance the item will be retrieved.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccess
data.info: Guaranteed Success means that the player will be guaranteed to successfully retrieve the target item on the specified attempt regardless of the Drop Rate percentage. The minimum and maximum range will be used to randomly choose the attempt at which this will occur (if the minimum and maximum are the same, then that value will always be used). So, for example, if the guaranteed attempt is set to 10, so after 9 attempts in a row without successfully retrieving the quest item (failing the percent roll), the 10th attempt will be guaranteed to succeed. After any successful attempt, the guaranteed success count resets and begins again. Guaranteed Success allows the quest to minimize a run of bad luck with the Drop Rate. It also allows a quest to have a limited number of quest targets by guaranteeing that the player will succeed on the last target if all of the others have failed. For example, if there are 10 chests and only 1 of them have the sword that the player must find, a Guaranteed Success of 10 will mean that if the player fails to find the sword in the first 9 chests, they will be guaranteed to find it in the 10th one. If the minimum/maximum values are left at 0, then Guaranteed Success will not be used.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccessMinumumAttempts
data.info: The minimum number of attempts for a guaranteed success. If the minimum equals the maximum, then that value will be used, otherwise a random value will be chosen between the minimum and maximum (inclusive). If set to 0, guaranteed success will not be used at all.

data.name: GuaranteedSuccessMaximumAttempts
data.info: The maximum number of attempts for a guaranteed success. If the maximum equals the minimum, then that value will be used, otherwise a random value will be chosen between the minimum and maximum (inclusive). If set to 0, guaranteed success will not be used at all.

data.name: CountdownTimer
data.info: The duration of the countdown timer, in seconds. If the countdown time is 0, then a countdown timer will not be used. The countdown timer is interrupted when you take damage, become incapacitated, or if you move further than 3m from the target object.

data.name: retrieveMenuText
data.info: The localized text string to display in the popup menu for the use option. If no value is provided, it will default to be the string Use.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Immediately give a reward and complete. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Experience
data.info: Information regarding the experience to grant as a reward.

data.name: Experience Type
data.info: The type of experience to give the player. Valid types are "quest_combat", "quest_general", "quest_crafting" or "quest_social".

data.name: Experience Amount
data.info: The amount of experience to give the player. This must be a positive number.

data.name: Faction
data.info: Information regarding the faction to grant as a reward.

data.name: Faction Name
data.info: The name of the faction to apply the faction amount to.

data.name: Faction Amount
data.info: The amount of faction to apply to faction name.

data.name: Bank Credits
data.info: The number of credits to put in the players bank account. This number must be positive.

data.name: Reward Loot
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: lootName
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: lootCount
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item
data.info: Information regarding the item to grant as a reward.

data.name: Item
data.info: The item server object template to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountItem
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Weapon
data.info: Information regarding the weapon to grant as a reward.

data.name: Weapon
data.info: The item server tobject emplate to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountWeapon
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Speed
data.info: How fast the weapon fire speed is, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Damage
data.info: How much damage the weapon does, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Efficiency
data.info: How efficient the special attack cost is, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Elemental Value
data.info: How much elemental damage the does, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Reward Armor
data.info: Information regarding the armor to grant as a reward.

data.name: Armor
data.info: The item server tobject emplate to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountArmor
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Quality
data.info: How good the armor is, 1 is the worst and 350 is the best.

data.name: Reward Badge
data.info: Badge to grant the player as a reward.

task.info: Display a message box to the player. This task completes when the player closes the window. There is no failure condition.

data.name: messageBoxTitle
data.info: A localized string that displays in the title section of the message box.

data.name: messageBoxText
data.info: A localized string that displays in the text section of the message box.

data.name: messageBoxSound
data.info: A sound that plays while the message box is open. The sound is not looped and ends when finished or when the message box is closed. An example use is voice-over for the message box text.

data.name: messageBoxWindowSettings
data.info: The window size and location settings for the message box.

data.name: messageBoxSizeWidth
data.info: The width of the message box in screen coordinates. If set to -1 with size fields (width and height) will be ignored and the default values will be used.

data.name: messageBoxSizeHeight
data.info: The height of the message box in screen coordinates. If set to -1 with size fields (width and height) will be ignored and the default values will be used.

data.name: messageBoxLocationX
data.info: The x screen coordinate of the left side of the message box window. If set to -1 with location fields (x and y) will be ignored and the default values will be used.

data.name: messageBoxLocationY
data.info: The y screen coordinate of the top side of the message box window. If set to -1 with location fields (x and y) will be ignored and the default values will be used.

task.info: Causes creatures or ships to spawn and optionally attack the player. A spawn task completes after the spawns are created.

data.name: chanceToSkip
data.info: The percentage chance from 0 to 99 that this task will immediately complete and not do the spawn. Default is 0 which means it is never skipped..

data.name: Ground Settings
data.info: These fields provide settings to use if the spawn goes off while the player is in a ground scene.

data.name: Creature Type
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that is spawned.

data.name: minCount
data.info: The minimum number of creatures to spawn.

data.name: maxCount
data.info: The maximum number of creatures to spawn. If the value is 0, then min count will always spawn.

data.name: Min Distance
data.info: The minimum distance around the player to spawn the creatures.

data.name: Max Distance
data.info: The maximum distance around the player to spawn the creatures.

data.name: minLevelDifference
data.info: Auto-level the spawned creatures from (player level - min) to (player level + max). If min and max are 0, no leveling occurs.

data.name: maxLevelDifference
data.info: Auto-level the spawned creatures from (player level - min) to (player level + max). If min and max are 0, no leveling occurs.

data.name: groundStartCombat
data.info: Indicates whether or not the spawned creatures should immediately start combat with the player.

data.name: buffName
data.info: The buff to apply to the player when the creatures are spawned. If blank, no buff is applied.

data.name: Dismount Control
data.info: These fields provide settings to control dismounting the player.

data.name: dismountPlayer
data.info: Indicates whether or not the player should be immediately dismounted when the creatures are spawned.

data.name: mountBlockDuration
data.info: The duration in seconds the player is blocked from mounting a vehicle or pet.

data.name: Space Settings
data.info: These fields provide settings to use if the spawn goes off while the player is in a space scene.

data.name: shipType
data.info: The space ship from the space mobiles data table that is spawned.

data.name: shipMinCount
data.info: The minimum number of ships to spawn.

data.name: shipMaxCount
data.info: The maximum number of ships to spawn. If the value is 0, then min count will always spawn.

data.name: spaceStartCombat
data.info: Indicates whether or not the spawned ships should immediately start combat with the player.

data.name: hyperspaceBlockDuration
data.info: If greater than 0, the amount of time in seconds to block the player from using hyperspace after the spawn task creates the ships. This will cause any hyperspace in progress to abort.

data.name: Delay Settings
data.info: These fields provide settings to control delaying when the spawn starts.

data.name: minStartDelay
data.info: The minimum amount of time to wait before starting the spawn. If the value is -1 then start immediately.

data.name: maxStartDelay
data.info: The maximum amount of time to wait before starting the spawn. If the value is -1 then start immediately.

task.info: A escort that requires the player follow an NPC to specific locations. If the escort dies or if the max allowed distance from target is violated, then the task fails.

data.name: Escort Creature Type
data.info: The creature from the creatures data table that the player must escort.

data.name: Maximum Allowed Distance from Target(m)
data.info: The maximum distance from the escort the player may be otherwise the task will fail.

data.name: Pathing Points
data.info: A set of points to which the player must follow the escort.

data.name: Point 1
data.info: The 1st escort point.

data.name: Point 1 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 1 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 1 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 1 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Point 2
data.info: The 2nd escort point.

data.name: Point 2 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 2 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 2 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 2 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Point 3
data.info: The 3rd escort point.

data.name: Point 3 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 3 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 3 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 3 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Point 4
data.info: The 4th escort point.

data.name: Point 4 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 4 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 4 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 4 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Point 5
data.info: The 5th escort point.

data.name: Point 5 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 5 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 5 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 5 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Point 6
data.info: The 6th escort point.

data.name: Point 6 Path to Point
data.info: Indicates whether or not to use this point.

data.name: Point 6 LocationX(m)
data.info: The X location of the point.

data.name: Point 6 LocationY(m)
data.info: The Y location of the point.

data.name: Point 6 LocationZ(m)
data.info: The Z location of the point.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Wait until the player converses with the named NPC. There is no failure condition.

data.name: NPC Name
data.info: The name of the NPC to which the player must converse.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Starts a timer. The timer runs using player played time. This task has a journal counter. The time completes when the time elapses. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Min Time
data.info: The minimum duration of the timer in seconds

data.name: Max Time
data.info: The maximum duraiton of the timer in seconds.

task.info: Wait until the name signal is emitting by script. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Signal Name
data.info: The name of the signal(s) which are used in script to complete this task. Multiple signals are seperated by commas. The task completes when any one of the signals is receieved.

data.name: Count
data.info: The number of signals to receive.

data.name: waitMarker
data.info: The following fields provide input for wait marker creation and cleanup. The wait marker is an object created when the task is active and destoryed when the task completes. This use must be limited to short tasks preferably in an instanced area like the tutorial. The object that is created is visible to everyone. Also there is no limit to the number spawned in a location (e.g. multiple players on the same quest).

data.name: waitMarkerCreate
data.info: Setting this to true enables creation otherwise no wait marker is automatically created.

data.name: waitMarkerTemplate
data.info: The server template of the object to create. If this field is left empty, the tutorial static waypoint object is created (object/static/structure/general/tutorial_waypoint.iff).

data.name: waitMarkerPlanetName
data.info: The planet name is used for exterior wait markers only. This field is ignore for interiors (it is determined at runtime by the building).

data.name: waitMarkerBuilding
data.info: The object id of the building to create the wait marker. If this value is 0, the building used is the one the player is in when the task activates.

data.name: waitMarkerCellName
data.info: The cell name of the building. Setting this field makes the marker an interior object.

data.name: waitMarkerX
data.info: The X value of the location. For interior markers, this should be the location relative to the cell (which can be determined using ctrl-shft-g in the game).

data.name: waitMarkerY
data.info: The Y value of the location. For interior markers, this should be the location relative to the cell (which can be determined using ctrl-shft-g in the game).

data.name: waitMarkerZ
data.info: The Z value of the location. For interior markers, this should be the location relative to the cell (which can be determined using ctrl-shft-g in the game).

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Wait for the named tasks to complete and then complete. Any number of tasks may be entered. All of them must complete for this task to complete. There is no failure condition.

data.name: Task 1
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task1 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task1 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task1 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Task 2
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task2 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task2 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task2 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Task 3
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task3 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task3 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task3 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Task 4
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task4 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task4 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task4 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Task 5
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task5 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task5 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task5 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Task 6
data.info: The following fields provide input for the tasks to wait on.

data.name: Task6 Quest Filename
data.info: The name of the quest which contains taskName.

data.name: Task6 taskName
data.info: The task name for which to wait.

data.name: Task6 Display String
data.info: A localized string to display in the journal. This must be set in order for the task counter to update.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

task.info: Triggers an event where waves of mobiles are spawned. The event is triggered by using an object. Only one event is allowed to be triggered at a time. A unique controller object must exist that can be used by a player to trigger this event.

data.name: Server Object Template
data.info: The server object template file name of the item that will be used to trigger the wave event.

data.name: waveEventMenuText
data.info: The localized text string to display in the popup menu for the use option. If no value is provided, it will default to be the string Use.

data.name: waveEventStartMessage
data.info: A localized string displayed to the player when they use the control object to start the wave event.

data.name: Wave 1
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 1.

data.name: primaryTargetWave1
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 1.

data.name: utteranceWave1
data.info: A localized string that the primary wave target in wave 1 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave1
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave1
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 1. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave1
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 1.

data.name: delayWave1
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 1 is spawned after the event is started.

data.name: Wave 2
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 2.

data.name: primaryTargetWave2
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 2.

data.name: utteranceWave2
data.info: A localized string that primary wave target in wave 2 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave2
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave2
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 2. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave2
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 2.

data.name: delayWave2
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 2 is spawned after wave 1 ends.

data.name: Wave 3
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 3.

data.name: primaryTargetWave3
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 3.

data.name: utteranceWave3
data.info: A localized string that primary wave target in wave 3 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave3
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave3
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 3. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave3
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 3.

data.name: delayWave3
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 3 is spawned after wave 2 ends.

data.name: Wave 4
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 4.

data.name: primaryTargetWave4
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 4.

data.name: utteranceWave4
data.info: A localized string that primary wave target in wave 4 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave4
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave4
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 4. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave4
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 4.

data.name: delayWave4
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 4 is spawned after wave 3 ends.

data.name: Wave 5
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 5.

data.name: primaryTargetWave5
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 5.

data.name: utteranceWave5
data.info: A localized string that primary wave target in wave 5 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave5
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave5
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 5. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave5
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 5.

data.name: delayWave5
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 5 is spawned after wave 4 ends.

data.name: Wave 6
data.info: The following fields provide input for wave 6.

data.name: primaryTargetWave6
data.info: The primary wave target from the creatures data table that will be spawned in wave 6.

data.name: utteranceWave6
data.info: A localized string that primary wave target in wave 6 will say. %TO in the utterance will input the player's name when used.

data.name: spawnRadiusWave6
data.info: The distance from the controller object at which the creatures will be spawned.

data.name: guardsWave6
data.info: The guards for the primary wave target that will be spawned in wave 6. Also from the creatures data table.

data.name: numGuardsWave6
data.info: The number of guards to be spawned in wave 6.

data.name: delayWave6
data.info: The number of seconds before wave 6 is spawned after wave 5 ends.

data.name: Time To Complete
data.info: An optional value, if the value is > 0 and the task is not completed in this many seconds, the task is failed.

list.info: Quest list fields provide information that is global to the quest (vs. specific to an individual tasks).

data.name: Level
data.info: The level of the quest.

data.name: Tier
data.info: The tier of the quest.

data.name: Type
data.info: The type of the quest.

data.name: questJournal
data.info: These fields provide text that is displayed in the quest journal.

data.name: journalEntryTitle
data.info: A short localized text string that is displayed in the title section of the journal. It is also displayed in the system message when a quest is activated or when a task completes (if system messages are enabled for the task).

data.name: journalEntryDescription
data.info: A longer more detailed localizd text string of the quest that is displayed in the quest journal when the journal title is selected.

data.name: category
data.info: A localized string that this quest is grouped under in the quest journal. The category is also display in the system message when a quest is granted to the player.

data.name: journalVisible
data.info: Indicates whether or not this quest shows up in the journal. To make an invisible quest and prevent system messages, the task's show system message flag must be set to false and the optional 3rd argument to grantQuest must be false to prevent the initial system message when the quest is granted.

data.name: journalEntryCompletionSummary
data.info: An end of quest summary of what happened. Be careful to only use general information, since saying Your next quest is with Jabba is only true UNTIL you talk to Jabba and do that quest.

data.name: questRules
data.info: These fields provide info on quest rules.

data.name: prerequisiteQuests
data.info: A comma delimited list of quest names that are required for this quest to be activated.

data.name: exclusionQuests
data.info: A comma delimited list of quest names that must not be completed for this quest to be activated.

data.name: allowRepeats
data.info: Indicated whether or not this quest may be received by the player multiple times.

data.name: questReward
data.info: The following fields define the reward granted to the player when they complete the entire quest.

data.name: Experience
data.info: Information regarding the experience to grant as a reward.

data.name: Experience Type
data.info: The type of experience to give the player. Valid types are "quest_combat", "quest_general", "quest_crafting" or "quest_social".

data.name: Experience Amount
data.info: The amount of experience to give the player. This must be a positive number.

data.name: Faction
data.info: Information regarding the faction to grant as a reward.

data.name: Faction Name
data.info: The name of the faction to apply the faction amount to.

data.name: Faction Amount
data.info: The amount of faction to apply to faction name.

data.name: GCW
data.info: Information regarding the faction to grant as a reward.

data.name: grantGcwPoints
data.info: Inidcates if the quest will grant GCW points on completion of the quest if applicable.

data.name: Overwrite GCW Amount
data.info: The flat amount of GCW you want to award the player with. Pre-existing GCW calculation systems are not used.

data.name: Overwrite SF GCW Amount Mod
data.info: This amount will multiply the GCW overwrite amount if the player is Special Forces Rebel or Imperial.

data.name: rebelLootName
data.info: The name of the loot rewarded to the Rebel Player.

data.name: rebelLootAmount
data.info: The number of loot items given to the Rebel Player.

data.name: imperialLootName
data.info: The name of the loot rewarded to the Imperial Player.

data.name: imperialLootAmount
data.info: The number of loot items given to the Imperial Player.

data.name: SfLootModifier
data.info: The factional loot count is multiplied by this amount if the player is special forces.

data.name: Bank Credits
data.info: The number of credits to put in the players bank account. This number must be positive.

data.name: inclusiveItemRewards
data.info: All listed items are granted when the quest is completed

data.name: Reward Item 1
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: lootName
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: lootCount
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 2
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: lootName2
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: lootCount2
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 3
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: lootName3
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: lootCount3
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusiveItemRewards
data.info: The player selects one of these items when the quest is completed

data.name: Reward Item 1
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 2
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName1
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount1
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 3
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName2
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount2
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 4
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName3
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount3
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 5
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName4
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount4
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 6
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName6
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount6
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 7
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName7
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount7
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 8
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName8
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount8
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 9
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName9
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount9
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item 10
data.info: Information regarding the loot to grant as a reward.

data.name: exclusivelootName10
data.info: The name of the loot to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: exclusivelootCount10
data.info: The number of loot items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Item
data.info: Information regarding the item to grant as a reward.

data.name: Item
data.info: The item server tobject emplate to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountItem
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Reward Weapon
data.info: Information regarding the weapon to grant as a reward.

data.name: Weapon
data.info: The item server tobject emplate to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountWeapon
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Speed
data.info: How fast the weapon fire speed is, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Damage
data.info: How much damage the weapon does, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Efficiency
data.info: How efficient the special attack cost is, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Elemental Value
data.info: How much elemental damage the does, 0.1 is the worst and 1.0 is the best.

data.name: Reward Armor
data.info: Information regarding the armor to grant as a reward.

data.name: Armor
data.info: The item server tobject emplate to place in the player's inventory.

data.name: CountArmor
data.info: The number of items to grant as a reward.

data.name: Quality
data.info: How good the armor is, 1 is the worst and 350 is the best.

data.name: Reward Badge
data.info: Badge to grant the player as a reward.

data.name: questPenalty
data.info: The following fields define penalties applied to the player when the quest is cleared.

data.name: Faction
data.info: Information regarding the faction to remove as a penalty.

data.name: penaltyFactionName
data.info: The name of the faction.

data.name: penaltyFactionAmount
data.info: The amount of faction to remove.

data.name: condtionalQuestGrant
data.info: Grant the given quest if the (comma separated) list of quests are ALL completed.

data.name: conditionalQuestGrantQuestToGive
data.info: The name of the quest to grant if the condition is met.

data.name: conditionalQuestGrantQuestsThatMustBeCompleted
data.displayName: Quests That Must Already Be Completed
data.info: If true, display the system message and play the grant quest music otherwise grant the quest silently.
